00001 #
00002 #  Function which creates a header which has the same form as the one created by the GUI Scan5U.
00003 #
00004 def createHeader():
00005         header = java.util.ArrayList()
00006         header.add("title")
00007         header.add("cond1")
00008         header.add("cond2")
00009         header.add( "cond3")
00010         header.add("MonoGrating position: " + `monochromator.getPosition("MonoGrating")`)
00011         header.add("MonoGrating offset: " + `monochromator.getOffset("MonoGrating")`)
00012         header.add("MonoMirror position: " + `monochromator.getPosition("MonoMirror")`)
00013         header.add("MonoMirror offset: " + `monochromator.getOffset("MonoMirror")`)
00014         header.add("UndulatorGap: " + `undulator.getPosition("UndulatorGap")`)
00015         header.add("UndulatorMutualPhase position:" + `undulator.getPosition("UndulatorMutualPhase")`)
00016         return header
00017 
00018 #
00019 # Scan specification which uses the createHeader() function. This scan will get the position 
00020 # information as it is at the start of the scan. 
00021 #
00022 
00023 stepScan = GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 700.0, 800.0, 20.0, 1000.0, "eV")
00024 stepScan.dataHandler.setHeader(createHeader())
00025 stepScan.runScan()
00026 
00027 #
00028 # Another example. This one creates the header first and then modifies the title and conditions
00029 #
00030 #
00031 
00032 stepScan = GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 700.0, 800.0, 20.0, 1000.0,  "eV")
00033 header = createHeader()
00034 header.set(0, "new title")
00035 header.set(1, "one")
00036 header.set(2, "two")
00037 header.set(3,"three")
00038 stepScan.dataHandler.setHeader(header)
00039 stepScan.runScan()
00040 
00041 #
00042 # Or you can create the header and add extra strings
00043 #
00044  
00045 stepScan = GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 700.0, 800.0, 20.0, 1000.0, "eV")
00046 header = createHeader()
00047 header.set(0, "header has extra lines")
00048 header.add("a line of special information")
00049 header.add("another line of special information")
00050 stepScan.dataHandler.setHeader(header)
00051 stepScan.runScan()
00052 
00053 #
00054 # You really only need to use MultiRegionScan if you have more than one region to do:
00055 #
00056 
00057 mrs = MultiRegionScan()
00058 mrs.addScan(GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 500.0, 600.0, 20.0, 1000.0, "eV"))
00059 mrs.addScan(GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 700.0, 800.0, 20.0, 1000.0, "eV"))
00060 header = createHeader()
00061 header.set(0, "Multi Region Scan")
00062 mrs.dataHandler.setHeader(header)
00063 mrs.runScan()
00064 
00065 #
00066 # You can use Jython for loops for multiple repeats. Lines within a particular loop should
00067 # be indented with a tab.  The `i` construction makes a string from a number. This 
00068 # nested pair of for loops will produce four scans.
00069 #
00070 
00071 header = createHeader()
00072 header.set(0, "Using for loops")
00073 for i in range(2):
00074         header.set(1, "outer " + `i`)
00075         for j in range(2):
00076                 header.set(2, "inner " + `j`)
00077                 stepScan = GridScanMoveToOnly(fixedfocus, 700.0, 800.0, 20.0, 1000.0, "eV")
00078                 stepScan.dataHandler.setHeader(header)
00079                 stepScan.runScan()
00080
